column4: I just installed Ubuntu 10.10, it popped out the CD from my drive, and I pressed enter once it was out. Now it's just sitting there (the computer) and the screen is pitch black. No key press works, it's like it froze up right before the reboot or something? This is a fresh install on a freshly formated disk - just I just manually turn the computer off or .... wait?
http://www.ubuntugeek.com/how-to-fix-ubuntu-10-04-lts-lucid-blank-screen-at-startup.html
if you use an nvidia video chip, use the bootoption: nouveau.blacklist=1   instead of the nomodeset one described
I have yet to enter Ubuntu, this is right after the installation completes.

I'm on ATI radeon
the boot options are appplied before the OS loads and will change how the kernel works
use the nomodeset option as described in the link then, should be ok

hold shift at boot and you can add the boot options

misunderstood earlier, sorry
